Wqq7pj85.title: Structure and Performances of Nano Silica/Polyacrylate Composite Dual Curing Emulsion
Wqq7pj85.abstract: The nano silica/polyacrylate composite dual curing emulsion was synthesized by core-shell polymerization.The influences of nano silica on thermal-UV dual curing rate,emulsion and film performances were analyzed, and the core-shell structure was characterized.The results show that the core-shell structure exists,and the average particle diamond is about 200nm.The emulsion and its film have the best performances when the mass fraction of nano silica is 5%,for example,the hardness of film is 4H,adhesion is 0 grade,ethanol resistance is 234 times of wiping without film breaking.The heat resistance is improved with the introduction of nano silica.

JVmFZKhl.title: Synthesis and Properties of Gemini Imidazoline Quaternary Ammonium Salts as Corrosion Inhibitor
JVmFZKhl.abstract: A new series of Gemini imidazoline quaternary ammonium salts as corrosion inhibitor(S-HSJ) was synthesized.The corrosion inhibition performance,the influences of carbon chain length in lipophilic structure,corrosion time and corrosion inhibitor concentration were investigated comprehensively.The experiments for copper,brass,aluminum and tinplate were conducted in 5% hydrochloric acid solutions with the help of mass loss method.The results show that the inhibition effects of the series of S-HSJ corrosion inhibitor are better than those of traditional quaternary ammonium salts and benzotriazole for several metals.The inhibition efficiency of S-HSJ-16 can reach 94%~99% when an amount of 0.1% such an inhibitor was added.The complex inhibition ability with anion surfactant shows an obviously synergistic effect.

I7tJmzXZ.title: Synthesize of molecular imprinted microsphere and research on its absorption property
I7tJmzXZ.abstract: Molecular imprinted polymers were synthesized via inverse emulsion polymerization and inverse suspension polymerization that aspirin(Asp)was used as the target imprinted molecular,and acrylamide(AM)and beta cyclodextrin(β-CD)were used as functional monomer.The red shifts of IR spectrum of the two kinds of polymeric microspheres indicated that the interaction between AM and Asp was mainly hydrogen bonding,but there had two kinds of interactions betweenβ-CD and Asp,one was hydrogen bonding interaction,and the other was complexed interaction.The research about absorption property mean that all of the polymeric microsphere kep the imprinting functions to Asp,and there existed two kinds of binding sites with different affinity.However,the result cleared that the affinity of P(βAsp)to Asp was stronger than that of P(AAsp).

J1gHzvQj.title: Study on UV-Curable Waterborne Polyurethane Acrylate Wood Coatings
J1gHzvQj.abstract: Using two kinds of synthetic UV curable waterborne resin,which were different in chain hardness; a research on blending and process of UV curable waterborne wood coatings were conducted. The influence of additives,especially the silica sol,on film performance and application technology of waterborne wood coatings was discussed. The experimental results showed that the UV curable waterborne wood lacquer could provide good adhesion,scratch resistance,hardness,chemical resistance,suitable for painting on industrial scale production of wood board.

8WU1Ow1c.title: On Strengthening the Cultivation of Innovative talents in Specialty-related Experimental Teaching
8WU1Ow1c.abstract: Cultivating innovative talents is an important task for higher education in the newperiod.Based on the theory of innovation quality education,the present study first reviews the impact of innovation consciousness,thinking and ability on cultivating creative talents,then suggests approaches to strengthening the innovation consciousness,fostering creative thinking,and abilities in experimental teaching,and finally it illustrates teachers role in this process

K2mWF366.title: Preparation and Adsorption Property of the Modified Chitosan Polycondensate
K2mWF366.abstract: Polycondensate of etherificated by Chitosan/Sodium alginate(CTS-AGS) was used as flocculating agent,the flocculating experiments on imitated wastewater with water soluble dye were investigated.The results showed that CTS-AGS had an optimistic effect on water soluble dye.When the pH value was 2.5～6.5 and the dosage of flocculating agent was 400 mg/L,the decolorization rate could be achieved over 94%,trubiding rate 94%,CODCr removal rate 96%,respectively.

LypgnN83.title: Synthesis of gemini quaternary ammonium salt surfactants and their application performance on fabric
LypgnN83.abstract: A new series of gemini-imidazoline quaternary ammonium salt surfactants(S-HSJ) was synthesized.Their effect on antistatic property,softness and wettability of polyester fabrics as well as the water-resistance of three kinds of fabric(polyamide,polyester and polypropylene) under the action of cross-linking role of the epoxy silane coupling agent KH560,cross-linking monomer N-hydroxymethyl acrylamide(MAM) and N,N-methylene bisacrylamide(MBA) were investigated.The results showed that,the antistatic action of gemini quaternary ammonium salt surfactant of S-HSJ series can reduce the resistance of polyester fabric to 107 Ω.S-HSJ-18 displays the best softening effect that can cause the stiffness of polyester fabric to be lower than 2 mN·m.The thermal setting fabric pretreatment process with KH560,MAM and MBA displays the best effect for cross-linking that can cause the wetting time of the fabric to be longer than 120 min and remains 90 min even after three times of washing.

dYXGep97.title: The Template Matching Algorithm Based on the Election Algorithm
dYXGep97.abstract: The image matching is a key problem as well as a difficult point in the computer vision field.The template matching algorithm is based on the election algorithm,which is a new heuristic optimization algorithm and simulates the motivation of election candidates to obtain the highest support ratio in campaign.It will reduce the running time and which has more advantage to traditional method.

vf4xgQWp.abstract: Micro-pitted cylinder is a novel engine cylinder, which has a number of advantages over the porous chromium-plated one and the platform-checker one,thus having a good application prospect.Being still in a development stage,however,the manufacturing technique for micro-pitted cylinder need to be further improved.The possible investigation fields for micro-pitted cylinder manufacture are put forward in the paper.

M3mc75lj.title: The Preparation and Mechanical Properties Analysis of Polyimide-silica Composite Laminates
M3mc75lj.abstract: Polyimide-silica composite laminate with outstanding room and high temperature mechanical properties,were obtained by preimpregnated fabrics be divided,folded and then moulded that were prepared via immersion of the mixture of polyimide acid solution and SiO2 and solvent dried. The results show that the mechanical property of the laminates is well at room temperature. The bending strength and modulus of the laminates are 120 MPa and 7.1 GPa,and the electrical property hold the level of 1011 Ω·m,at 300 ℃. To the laminate,the reservation of mechanical property is excellent and can be used as the load-carrying structure at high temperature.

w4MJnF5t.title: Study on Modification of Stryrene-Acrylic Emulsion with Phosphoric Acrylate
w4MJnF5t.abstract: A modified stryrene-acrylic emulsions with strong adhesion were prepared with the help of copolymerization of P-A、MMA、St、BA、AA by means of pre-emulsification technology and semi-continuous seed emulsion polymerization.The results showed that when the addition amount of phosphoric acrylate is 5%,the adhesion strength of film on aluminum,sheet,galvanized sheet,tin-plate,ABS,PVC,glass plate,etc.can be improved from grade 3～5 to grade 0～1,the hardness on glass from H to 2H and and water-resistance of coating from 12 h to 192 h,which also could improve polymerization stability and Ca2+ stability of emulsion.

TVwbUCah.title: End Functional Polystyrene Synthesized via Atom Transfer Radical Polymerization and the Research about the Content of End Living Groups
TVwbUCah.abstract: End functional polymer(PS-NH-SO3Na) was synthesized via atom transfer radical polymerization(ATRP) followed by end group substituent,of which the structures and kinetics were characterized and researched.It was compared with the weight retention of powder which was made by assembling between PS-NH-SO3Na or PS-SO3Na and surface cationic silica.The conclusion of kinetic researching shows that living end functional polymer can be achieved as much as possible when the conversation of monomer below 85%.The weight retention analysis of the two kinds of powder referred above means that some dead polymers exist in the total polymers.

VjF79wbc.title: Synthesis of Fuberidazole by Phase Transfer Catalysis
VjF79wbc.abstract: The fuberidazole was prepared by reaction of O-phenylendiamine with furfural at the presence of CTMABas catalyst.The influence of reaction temperature,reaction time,catalyst and molar ratio of raw materials on product yieldwas studied.Experimental results showed that the optimum conditions are as follows:n(O-phenylendiamine) ∶n(furfural) ∶n(hydrochloric acid) =1∶2.5∶1.2,the reaction temperature was(65 ± l) ℃,the reaction time was 4 h,the quality ofthe catalyst was 0.5 g/0.1mol of O-phenylendiamine.The yield of the product was 87.33% under the optimum conditions.

2ntNsstU.title: The effect of Ce,Zr,Pd dopant on the properties and catalytic performance of NiMgAl hydrotalcites-like compounds and its derived mixed oxides
2ntNsstU.abstract: NiMgAl,NiMgCeAl,NiMgAlZr and NiPdMgAl hydrotalcite-like compounds were prepared by hydrothermal method,and the study were emphasized on the influence of Ce,Zr,Pd species dopant on the structure,properties and catalytic performance of NiMgAl hydrotalcites-like compounds and its derived mixed oxides.The hydrotalcite-like compounds and its derived mixed oxides were characterized by XRD,TPR,TPD,TPO and BET.The sample doped Ce species have showed relatively high surface area and better catalytic performance.The sample doped Pd have showed a enhanced H2 adsorption capacity,better catalytic performance and lower level of carbon deposition.But the sample doped ZrO2 have showed relatively low surface area and low catalytic active.

p53oOs3x.title: Synthesis and Application of UV Curable Cellulose Ester
p53oOs3x.abstract: The UV curable modified cellulose acetate-butyrate was synthesized by using isocyanate(IPDI),hydoxyl ethyl methacrylate and cellulose acetate-butyrate as raw materials.The difference of properties between CAB and UV curable modified CAB were compared and the effects of different active monomers and their amount on property of UV curable CAB film were discussed.It was shown that the hardness,abrasion resistance,water resistance and solvent resistance of the film based on modified CAB were improved.The properties of coatings with modified CAB were as follows: gloss 138,hardness 4H,adhesion grade 1,water resistance 72 hours and good solvent resistance.

kz2bY4HS.title: Study on Acrylate Emulsion Adhesive for Plastic
kz2bY4HS.abstract: Synthesis of acrylate copolymerization emulsion which was modified by hydrogenated rosin was studied and the emulsion adhesive for plastic was obtained. The effect of hydrogenated rosin amount on the adhesion of the adhesive was studied. The results showed that, when the hydrogenate rosin amount was 5% of the whole monomer, the copolymerization modified acrylate emulsion had excellent adhesion for PE, PET and PP. Compared with the pure acrylate emulsion, the initial bonding strength of the modified one increased by 58%, the endurance bonding strength increased from 110min to 294min, and peeling strength raised from 2.8N/cm to about 7.2N/cm, and the storage stability of emulsion was more than 3 months.

XuIz6yn6.title: Study on chlorinated polypropylene emulsion modified graft copolymerization
XuIz6yn6.abstract: With acrylate monomers as graft-comonomers,a chlorinated polypropylene(CPP) emulsion with aromatic-free and low VOC was synthesized.With grafting degree and water resistance as evaluating indexes,the optimal process conditions of preparing CPP emulsion were preferred by single-factor experiment.The results showed that the corresponding CPP emulsion had reversely better combination property,and the adhesive power between CPP emulsion and polypropylene(PP) base material was reversely optimal when reaction temperature and reaction time were 95 ℃ and 3.5 h respectively,mass fraction of total initiators was 1.0%(thereinto 10% initiator was introduced into system before dropping monomers,and interval was 10 min),mass fractions of acrylate monomers and acrylic acid were 30% and 5% respectively.

Qu1j8mrW.title: Research on the Synthesis and Reaction Conditions of Dendritic Polyether
Qu1j8mrW.abstract: Dendritic polyethers from the first to the third generation,which benzyl bromine is the core,were synthesized by reaction of Williamson and halogenating reaction.1H NMR and DSC were used to characterize the structure and melt point of the dendritic polyether,respectively.The halogenated efficiency of thionyl chloride,phosphlrus tribromide and tetrabromomethane were compared,and the catalytic effect of 18-crown-6 and polyglycol 400 were studied.The results show that the melt points of the dendritic polyethers from the first to the third generation are 80℃,107℃ and 122℃,the yields of dendritic polyether are much higher than that of the others' when tetrabromomethane and 18-crown-6 are used.

60OQX2uF.title: Study on Nonionic Self-emulsifying Waterborne Epoxy Emulsion
60OQX2uF.abstract: A high performance nonionic water dispersible epoxy resin emulsion was prepared by chemical modification.Effect of different molecular weights of polyethyleneglycol,mass ratio of epoxy resin E-51 and polyethylene glycol,the amount of emulsifier and catalyst,reaction temperature,and time on reaction process and emulsion properties were discussed.The properties of two kinds of waterborne epoxy emulsion prepared by phase inversion method and the high-temperature self-emulsifying method were compared.The experimental data showed that the stability and the particle size of waterborne epoxy emulsion prepared by self-emulsifying method was better than that by phase inversion method.And when the mass ratio of polyethylene glycol 4000 and epoxy resin E-51=1∶1,the emulsion particle size was less than 0.5 μm;and showed good storage stability and no separation after six month storage at room temperature;film hardness over 2H;adhesion 1 grade.The coatings also showed good water resistance.

vh8tuL6L.title: Study on UV-Curing High Performance Cellulose Ester Coatings
vh8tuL6L.abstract: Cellulose acetate butyrate(CAB)was grafted with anhydride,which was used to prepare the UV-curable modified cellulose ester resin.The effects of active monomers and photoinitiators on the properties of modified CAB were discussed.Coating performance on different substrates were also studied.The solvent resistance and scratch resistance of the modified CAB were significantly improved.The hardness could reach 4H,the gloss(60°) 130,and the acetone rub test were over 400 times.

PeZemLDZ.title: Research Progress and Advice in Polymer Brushes Constructed on Silica Particles
PeZemLDZ.abstract: Polymer brushes constructed on substrates or interface are a kind of material surface modification approaches with a great application potential.The main methods of polymer brushes constructed on substrates,interfaces,and especially on the surfaced of silica were introduced from that of the concept and formation conditions.On the basis above,the application of silica particles and the defects are indicated,with further development suggestions.

30lybgCM.title: EFFECT OF PREPARATION METHOD ON THE CATALYTIC PERFORMANCE OF NiCoPrLa HYDROTALCITE DERIVED COMPOSITE OXIDES
30lybgCM.abstract: NiCoLaPr hydrotalcite-like compounds was synthesized by PLS,PHS and hydrothermal method.At the same time,the crystal structure and catalytic performance of ethanol vapor reforming production hydrogen reaction of NiCoPrLa hydrotalcite were characterized by XRD,H2-TPR,C2H5OH-TPD,TPO.Hydrothermal preparation of samples can form higher crystallinity and relatively complete crystal structure.The derived composite oxides catalytic steam reforming of ethanol showed higher activity,H2 selectivity and resistance to carbon deposition.Conversion rate of ethanol was 100% at 450℃,and the selectivity of H2,CO2 and CO were 80.56%,95.35% and 4.56% respectively.

TkMOL6h7.title: Synthesis and Characterization of the Structure of Dendritic Polyether block Polystyrene by Atom Transfer Radical Polymerization
TkMOL6h7.abstract: Dendritic-linear polyether block polystyrene was synthesized via atom transfer radical polymerization(ATRP)that the dendritic polyether having the core of —CH2Br,copper(I) bromide and 2,2′-biphenyl as the initiator,catalyst and ligand respectively.Element Analysis instrument was used to analysis the content of carbon and hydrogen belonged to the dendritic polyether initiators.IR Spectra and HNMR were chosen to characterize the structure of the dendritic-linear polymers.The results show that the component of the dendritic polyether form the first to the third generations are according with the perfect component;the dendritic-linear polymer initiated by the dendritic polyether have the clear structure,but the bromide at the end of polymer chains may be removed under the polymerized conditions.

s6mZuZ2i.title: Application Research of Anionic Foaming Agent in Fly Ash Foam Cement
s6mZuZ2i.abstract: A composite foaming agent was prepared from sodium alpha-olefin sulfonate(AOS),sodium alcohol ether sulphate(AES),sodium dodecyl benzene sulfonate(LAE) and homemade foam-stabilizer.Then the foaming performance of the composite foaming agent was tested,and effect of the composite foaming agent dosage on the compressive strength and thermal conductivity of fly ash foam cement was studied.The results show that,the foam performance of AOS is better than that of AES and LAS;the homemade foam stabilizer will slightly decrease the foaming capacity of foaming agent,but it will improve the foam stability significantly.The thermal conductivity of the foam cement paste will be reduced to 0.12 W /(m K) with compressive strength of 1.6 MPa when using 3.5% composite foaming agent with 0.8% AOS and 0.3% foam-stabilizer.

IrNH0Gyt.title: Reflection on Curriculum Designing and Talents Training in Applied Chemestry
IrNH0Gyt.abstract: In higher education,specialty training program is a programmatic document for personnel training,in which the designing of curriculum and training of specialized personnel are strongly interrelated.According to the feature of economics situation of Guangdong province and characteristic of running schools of ourselves,some con sideration and method of working upon arrangement of specialties and training of specialized personnel for applied chemistry were developed.Adding strength to applied specialty courses and some course of frontier and cross-disciplines reflects the considerations on the training personnel with broad outlook and confronting market.

nPa02gfa.title: Improvements of Experiments of Rectification and Filter Unit Operations in Chemical Engineering
nPa02gfa.abstract: Unit operations of chemical engineering is the core curriculum of chemical specialty system.It plays a role in the future between basic courses and specialized courses,and it has important significance for other professional courses study.In this paper,in the experimental teaching of unit operations of chemical engineering,the existing problem of experiment device was analysed,and the improvements of rectification and filtration experiment device were carried out.Finally,the used effect of the equipment improved was investigated.

GO5z3HqP.title: Study on UV and Heat Dual Curing Process of Epoxy Modified Waterborne UV-Curable Epoxy Acrylate
GO5z3HqP.abstract: Waterborne UV-curable epoxy acrylate emulsion and epoxy emulsion were synthesized.UV and heat dually curable emulsion was prepared by blending at a certain rato.The optimal curing process was studied.The two emulsions were blended at 1∶4 ratio,and cured by UV-heat dual curing under initiation of photoinitiator.The performance of this dual curable emulsion is hardness 3H,water resistance 48 h,adhesion 0 grade.ethanol-resistant 58 times of rub without film breaking.

oXitEDEh.title: The Research of the Degradation of Bromophenol Blue via the CNT-TiO_2 Photocatalyst
oXitEDEh.abstract: Titania sol was synthesized via sol-gel method that tetrabutyl titanate was the precursor,ethanol as the solvent and hydrochloric acid as the catalyst.Then,the TiO2 sol prepared was loaded on the purified carbon nanotube followed by calcinating at different temperature.The structure of calcinated and loaded TiO2 before and was characterized by IR spectra,and the degradation rate of bromophenol blue was studied under the irradiation of daylight.The results show that CNT-TiO2 catalyst can be prepared by being loaded on CNT of TiO2 sol,and the efficiency of TiO2 catalyst can be improved promptly.The degradation rate of brophenol blue reaches 89 percent in twenty minutes which is much higher than that of the unloaded.The efficiency of CNT-TiO2 is better when CNT-TiO2 is calcinated at 400 degree.

wtX9dpi7.title: Synthesis and application research of epoxy modified water-borne alkyd resins
wtX9dpi7.abstract: This paper introduces the synthesis of epoxy modified water-borne alkyd resin and the preparation of excellent performance iron oxide red primer with this.The influences of epoxy resin,technical condition,experimental parameters on the properties of water-borne alkyd resins are discussed,optimal recipe is obtained,and the product is characterized by IR.The hard work of varnish which prepared by this recipe is 16 h,the pencil hardness is HB,the adhesion strength is 0 class,it has good water resistance and storage stability.

EkLz1Pjl.title: Study on new two-component room temperature curing acrylate adhesive
EkLz1Pjl.abstract: Two-component room temperature curing acrylate adhesive was synthesized by polyacrylate and epoxy acrylate. The influence of the fraction of main component in acrylate adhesive, the influence of active monomer on tensile strength and the influence of storing stability of the system upon the performance of the adhesive were investigated. Moreover, oxidation/reduction system and suitable time for curing were also ascertained. The results showed that the tensile strength of this adhesive can reach 23.5MPa.

L73mhFHS.title: Preparation and Characteristics of High Performance Epoxy Resin Emulsion
L73mhFHS.abstract: A high performance cationic epoxy resin emulsion was prepared via chemical modification.The optimum synthesis process,emulsion properties and film performances were studied.The experiment results showed that epoxy resin emulsion prepared with epoxy resin E-51 showed good stability and excellent performances,in which the dispersed phase particle size was 0.1～0.3 μm,pot life was 4 h,film was transparent and hardness was 2H～3H.

x38mijRe.title: Study of Composite Catalyst for the Synthesis of Photosensitive Epoxy Acrylates Oligomer
x38mijRe.abstract: A type of composite catalyst of triethylamine,triphenylphosphine and tetraethylammonium bromide with synergistic effect is developed.The effects of catalyst components,reaction temperature and reaction time on the property of esterification product of epoxy resin with acrylic acid are discussed.The results show that the composite catalyst has higher activity.Thus,when the mass ratio of composite catalyst to epoxy resin is 0.01,reacting at 105 ℃ for 2.5 h,the esterification rate is greater than 99%,and the appearance of the product is water-white with viscosity being 300 seconds and short curing time.

XpthWSGa.title: The Study of Fluoroacrylate Modified Hydroxyl Acrylic Emulsion
XpthWSGa.abstract: Fluoroacrylate modified hydroxyl acrylic emulsion was synthesized by pre-emulsion and semi-continuous emulsion polymerization,with perfluoroalky acrylate(Zonyl TM) as functional monomer,and a mixture of anionic and nonionic emulsifier as emulsifier,which was then used together with melamine resin to give high performance acrylic-melamine varnish.The effects of fluorine-containing monomer,crosslinking monomer,acrylic acid amount and the ratio of styrene and methyl methacrylate on the film performance were systematically investigated.And the factors influencing the compatibility and storage stability of varnish were discussed.Additionally,water contact and the FT-IR of the fluorine-containing emulsion film were analyzed.The results showed that Zonyl TM was effectively involved in the copolymerization and improved the water resistance and chemical resistance of the film.

U7UOXtoq.title: Study on Synthesis and Properties of High Performance Core-shell Structure Heat-curing Acrylate Emulsion
U7UOXtoq.abstract: The core-shell structure waterborne acrylate emulsion could be prepared with methyl methacrylate(MMA),butyl acrylate(BA) and other functional monomers,such as AA,HEMA etc as raw materials by means of emulsion polymerization.The influences of different synthesis technologies of core-shell design,reaction temperature and neutralization degrees on the emulsion polymerization and the influences of amount of initiator on conversion and gelation rate,and the effects of different curing methods on performance of emulsion film are discussed in detail.

ZYyKKUrM.title: Study on Anticorrosion Performance of Environment Friendly Water-Based Multiple Coatings
ZYyKKUrM.abstract: Through the on-site examination of hydrolysis degree of silane,the optimun concentration of KH-560 for corrosion protection was determined.The film formation of by drolized silane on steel surface,then composited with waterborne coatings,forming a multiple coating layer and enhance corrosion protection of steel.The research discovered that the anti-corrosive performance of the compound film was increased about 4～5 times of that of acrylic emulsion coatings film and promoted the adhesion of water-based coating.

zWyWu1gb.title: Study on heat-UV radiation cross-linking film of waterborne polyacrylate
zWyWu1gb.abstract: The functional monomer Acetoacetoxyethyl-methyacrylate was introduced into the polyacrylate emulsion,and at the same time c=c was introduced into the polyacrylate emulsion through Michael addition reaction at ambient conditions,then thermal-radiation crosslinking of waterborne polyacrylate was achieved by UV irradiation.The synthesis of polyacrylate and film-forming condition were optimized.The results of experiment showed that the film had excellent properties: the ethanol-resistant wipe was 158 times,the hardness was 3H and the alkali-resistance was 24 hours.

Nlwrn3Vl.title: Study on Synthesis of Waterborne Styrene-Modified Alkyd Resin
Nlwrn3Vl.abstract: The title waterborne styrene-modified alkyd resin was prepared through graft copolymerization of styrene and acrylic acid with alkyd resin prepared by fatty acid process.The influence of different oil length,K value,amount of styrene and acrylic acid on film properties were studied and the optimal formulation of waterborne styrene-modified alkyd resin was finalized.And the properties of waterborne unmodified alkyd varnish,waterborne styrene-modified alkyd varnish and solvent-based styrene-modified alkyd varnish were compared.The results showed that the film of drying time and handness of waterborne styrene-modified alkyd resin were much improved than unmodified alkyd resin,which is close to the solvent-based styrene-modified alkyd resin.When the oil length of alkyd resin was 60%,K value was 1.05,the mass fraction of styrene was 35% and acrylic acid 6.5%,the surface drying time of the modified alkyd resin could be 0.5 h and the hard drying time 20 h at room temperature,and film hardness HB.And the resin was well dispersed in water,the alkali resistance and water resistance were improved.The waterborne styrene-modified alkyd resin can meet the requirement of high performance and environment friendly.

PzSol1C7.title: Synthesis and Characterization of Dendritic Polyether from the First to the Third Generations
PzSol1C7.abstract: Dendritic polyethers from the first to the third generations,which the core is benzyl alcohol,were synthesized via one step and two step methods.The material used in synthesis included 3,5-dihydroxybenzyl alcohol,methyl 3,5-dihydroxybenzoate,benzyl halide and potassium carbonate.18-Crown-6 was used as catalyst and the structure of the product was characterized by IR spectrum and halogenating reaction respectively.The results show that the project products can be synthesized via one or two step method and the yield of product via one step method is much higher than that of two step method.

xdrZRdwn.title: Image Enhancement Method Based on Optimal Election Algorithm
xdrZRdwn.abstract: This paper uses the incomplete Beta transformation for the digital images self-adapting enhancement processing,the parameters of the transformation are provided by competitive algorithm optimization method,then a measure function has presented as the object function of image effect judgement,and filter out the largest result as optimal choice.Finally,a Matlab program is provided according the above method,it can get two convergent curve about two parameters,convergent curve of measure function and the histogram of image after process.The simulation results show that the above algorithm is able to adaptively enhance the images gray scale,the enhanced images have more equal gray distribution,and the contrast is rapidly progressed.

QGpiQvGY.title: Improved election-survey algorithm for unequal multimodal function optimization problem
QGpiQvGY.abstract: The algorithm is improved by using the location coordinates of the candidates as global survey-samples,comparing the prestige of local survey-samples and candidate. It can be use in unequal multi-peak problems. The computing results show that improved election-survey algorithm is able to find out the global optimal solution and several sub-optimal solutions very quickly.

aZTgd2YN.title: Research on Cut-in Grid of Doubly Fed Induction Generator System
aZTgd2YN.abstract: As the wind power system is becoming more and more larger,the inrush current when the wind turbine cut in grid is getting people′s attention.Many research is carried out on how to reduce the inrush current.A discrete doubly fed induction generator(DFIG) cut-in simulation model of Matlab 6.5 Simulink was built.According to the simulation result,some factor of inrush current was presented.The discrete model includes the sampling effect,computing error of the DSP and sensor′s error of actual system.Through analysis the experiment and simulation results the reason of the difference was presented.The experiment result shows that the discrete model is more closely to the actual system than the ideal model and the discrete model could help us to reduce the inrush current when the generator cut in grid.

oFFw3Y8T.title: Reactive Power Control Strategy for Doubly-Fed Induction Wind Power Generation System Under Fault in Power Network
oFFw3Y8T.abstract: Doubly-fed induction generator (DFIG) is progressively becoming the mainstream of wind power generation, commonly the reactive power control strategy using unity power factor is applied to DFIG units.The power system fault makes terminal voltage of DFIG descended, so the traditional unity power factor operating mode may not maintain the stable operation of power system this moment and it is needed to provide reactive power by wind farm to help power system to recover stable operation.In this paper, taking a 9 MW wind farm consisting of DFIG units for example, the simulation of the two situations, i.e., keeping the unity power factor operating mode and the control strategy using grid side converter to implement reactive power compensation, is respectively conducted under the condition that the network voltage descends to 15% of rated voltage.Simulation results show that when power system fault is cleared, the reactive power support provided by grid side converter of DFIG units can enhance the capability of recovering stable operation of power system obviously.

DZGkozKd.title: Realization Method of Driving-pulse of Multilevel Converter and Its Application
DZGkozKd.abstract: For multi-modular converters and multilevel converters,the number of PWM generators provided by the IC is not sufficient clearly.In such occasion,a special purpose multiplex PWM generator is essential.Field programmable gate array(FPGA)along with its programming system is a new technique for VLSI.Under the support of FPGA development system software,designers can directly define and modify its logic function according to system demand.Special purpose multiplex PWM generator can be conveniently implemented by FPGA,which is very promising to multi-modular converters and multilevel converters.Experimental result shows the frequency spectrum of experimental wave and nature sample simulated wave are very close.

p7DElOpZ.title: Review of voltage sag generator for wind power
p7DElOpZ.abstract: The VSG(Voltage Sag Generator) is used to test the LVRT(Low Voltage Ride-Through) capability of wind power system,and its research work at home and abroad is summarized in detail.Three solutions are discussed: impedance-type VSG simulates voltage sags by adding series or parallel impedance in main circuit;transformer-type VSG simulates voltage sags by changing transformer combinations or taps;electronics-type VSG simulates voltage sags by using semiconductor power devices,which is more functional.Their work principles and implementations are analyzed and compared.Transformer-type VSG is widely used now because of its simple structure,high reliability and low cost,while electronics-type VSG will get more applications for its small size and better performance.

LgylyzAm.title: Development of voltage-dip generator for wind power system
LgylyzAm.abstract: This article describes a circuit of voltage-dip generator for the research of wind turbine running under voltage-dip.The type and the time of voltage-dip were set hrough SCI,A PC communicated with a PIC.Experiment has proved that the equipment could realize the basic function of the expensive overseas equipment.

ixk8lbhy.title: Characteristic study of impedance of Li-ion battery based on wavelet mix model
ixk8lbhy.abstract: Power storage system is the most important supporting part of energy bidirectional flowing of smart grid,and large-scale group technology is the development bottleneck of large-scale power storage system.By combining Li-ion battery equivalent circuit model with wavelet analysis on the basis of discharging characteristic of Li-ion battery,analyzing the 3-D relationship among resistance of battery,SOC and time of discharge,the conclusion that the trend of resistance of battery was different in different phase was presented.It was also the basic theory judgement for single battery removing of batteries manages system.And it might also provide a reference for precise estimate of SOC.

vrr4uVdx.title: Operating modes of photovoltaic/energy-storage hybrid system and its control strategy
vrr4uVdx.abstract: The operating modes of photovoltaic/energy-storage hybrid system are analyzed,including whole system mode,energy storage bypass mode and energy storage support mode.Its topology is proposed with the flow direction control,which is verified by the simulation with the operational data of a 100 kWp photovoltaic system.The integration of photovoltaic system and energy storage system increases the system controllability and grid-connection flexibility,improves the system output characteristics of load response,and reduces greatly the system requirements for grid power transmission capacity.

mjtYXPkQ.title: Research on Low Voltage Ride through Characteristics of Doubly-Fed Induction Generator Based on Wind Power System
mjtYXPkQ.abstract: Doubly-fed induction generator is widely used in the wind power generation system due to its advantage of controlling active and reactive power independently, and only a percentage of the power produced by the generator has to pass through the AC excitation converter. However, the converter is quite sensitive to grid disturbance because of its limited partial capacity compared with the generator rating. Nowadays the grid code demands that the wind power generator possesses the ability of riding through the grid voltage dips, in order to prevent the more severe successive grid faults. To protect the converter and to support the grid, it is needed to limit the high inrush rotor current and provide a bypass for it via a crowbar, which is connected to the rotor windings. In this paper, a novel crowbar control strategy is proposed to limit the over current in the rotor, the over voltage of the DC bus. Experiment results prove that crowbar circuit is able to improve the LVRT of DFIG system.

6FxpDTUg.title: Strategy to cope with the VSCF-DFIG during voltage dip
6FxpDTUg.abstract: The paper proposes a method for a variable speed constant frequency wind turbine with doubly-fed induction generator (DFIG) to stay connected to the grid during grid faults. The key of the method is to limit the inrush current in the rotor in order to protect the converter and to provide a bypass for this current via a set of resistors that are connected to the rotor windings. In order to regulate network voltage, stabilize weak network, the DFIG using the proposed method can supply reactive power fast, hold system supply stability, reduce risk of voltage collapse and network splitting. All this has been verified by simulation.

iOLmVdvv.title: Improved direct electrooxidation of formic acid by increasing Au fraction on the surface of PtAu alloy catalyst with heat treatment
iOLmVdvv.abstract: The PtAu/C alloy catalyst is firstly synthesized by the co-reduction of both metal precursors under microwave conditions and then heat-treated to enable the migration of Au atoms to the exterior surface of the obtained PtAu/C catalyst. The bulk crystallite structures and the surface Au contents of PtAu/C catalysts are characterized by X-ray diffraction and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, respectively. The electrocatalytic activity and durability measurements exhibit the superior catalytic performance of PtAu/C catalysts over that of Pt/C catalyst on formic acid electrooxidation. Moreover, the initial and final activity after 3600 s reaction of the heat-treated PtAu/C alloy catalyst is two and five times as high as that of the untreated PtAu/C catalyst. The performance enhancement of the PtAu/C catalysts is discussed in terms of the electronic effect and ensemble effect. © 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

HKdW8Fkg.title: Promoting effect of vanadium ions on the anodic Pd/C catalyst for direct formic acid fuel cell application
HKdW8Fkg.abstract: In order to improve the catalytic activity and stability of the anodic Pd catalyst for a direct formic acid fuel cell, vanadium ions in very low concentration were introduced to the electrolyte. It was discovered that the electrooxidation of formic acid could be promoted greatly by addition of trace amount of vanadium ions. A much greater enhancement in catalytic stability (3.19 times) was observed when compared to the improvement in catalytic activity (1.57 times), indicating the effective protection of Pd from deactivation by addition of vanadium ions into the electrolyte. The improvement in the catalytic performances may be attributed to the facilitating of formic acid elelctrooxidation due to the existence of VO 2+ /V 3+ redox pair and the ensemble effect induced by the adsorption of vanadium ions onto the surface of Pd.

3SSiUklT.title: A modified Nafion membrane with extremely low methanol permeability via surface coating of sulfonated organic silica.
3SSiUklT.abstract: We developed a method to significantly decrease the methanol permeability of a Nafion membrane that does not require sacrificing its proton conductivity and mechanical stability. The Nafion membrane modified by the coating of a thin layer of sulfonated organic silica on the membrane surface exhibits significantly decreased methanol permeability--the permeability is decreased to an undetectable level--while retaining an acceptable ionic conductivity of 0.029 S cm(-1).

VV0BsqGu.title: Enhanced electroactivity of Pd nanocrystals supported on H 3PMo 12O 40/carbon for formic acid electrooxidation
VV0BsqGu.abstract: The preparation of highly dispersed precious metal catalysts is an important subject for fuel cell applications. Here, using a phosphomolybdic acid (PMo 12)-assisted method, a Pd-PMo 12/C catalyst with uniform Pd nanoparticles is prepared. The TEM results show that the presence of PMo 12 facilitates the formation of uniform Pd particles with an average particle size of 3.2 nm. More importantly, the Pd-PMo 12/C catalyst displays an enhanced activity and stability for formic acid electro-oxidation and a better tolerance toward CO poisoning than Pd nanocatalysts prepared with sodium citrate as a stabilizer. A combination of the composition and structure analyses show that the reasons for the improved electro-catalytic activity of the Pd-PMo 12/C catalyst involve the metal-support interaction, the richer Pd oxide/hydrous oxide content and the inherent properties of PMo 12. © 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

ClQafRaX.title: Inhibiting CO formation by adjusting surface composition in PtAu alloys for methanol electrooxidation.
ClQafRaX.abstract: CO poisoning during methanol electrooxidation was investigated on PtAu alloys with different surface compositions. Results show that the CO formation can be reduced gradually with increasing surface Au fractions in PtAu alloys and CO poisoning can be almost eliminated by adjusting to a proper surface Au fraction.

Glo78Bo2.title: Investigations of Pt modified Pd/C catalyst synthesized by one-pot galvanic replacement for formic acid electrooxidation
Glo78Bo2.abstract: Pt modified Pd/C catalysts were synthesized through galvanic replacement method in a one-pot synthetic process, where the replacement reaction was influenced greatly by the presence of the haloids (Cl- or Br -) in the solution. The catalysts with and without Pt modification were characterized with X-ray diffraction (XRD), X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), energy dispersive X-Ray spectroscopy (EDX) and electrochemical tests. The modified state and atomic ratio of Pt to Pd due to the variation of synthetic conditions were confirmed by the physical characterizations. The variation in structure/surface composition of the Pt-Pd/C catalysts leaded to different reaction mechanism and varied the performance of formic acid electrooxidation, which were confirmed by the electrochemical tests. The Pd/C catalyst modified with Pt in the presence of Cl- possesses satisfactory comprehensive performance, i.e. both stability and activity, for formic acid electrooxidation (FAEO). The results are of significance for designing catalysts for practical application of direct formic acid fuel cell and understanding mechanism of FAEO on noble metals composite structures. ? 2013, Hydrogen Energy Publications, LLC. Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights.

R8MGiqVB.title: A comparative study of Pt/C and Pt–MoOx/C catalysts with various compositions for methanol electro-oxidation
R8MGiqVB.abstract: The methanol electro-oxidation behaviors on the Pt–MoO x /C catalysts with various compositions were investigated and compared to those of Pt/C catalyst by cyclic voltammetry and chronoamperometry. The Pt–MoO x /C catalysts were prepared by depositing Pt on the MoO x /C support obtained by precipitation-reduction method in advance. The physical properties of the prepared catalysts were characterized by XRD, XPS, EDX and TEM. From the results of XRD and TEM, it was shown that the MoO x /C support facilitated the dispersion of Pt particles. All the Pt–MoO x /C catalysts showed relative lower Mo contents comparing to their nominal values. No PtMo alloy was formed in these catalysts, which were affirmed by XPS and XRD. It was found that all the Pt–MoO x /C catalysts showed higher mass activity (normalized to the mass of Pt) but lower specific activity (normalized to the electrochemical active surface areas) for methanol oxidation than the Pt/C catalyst. With the increase of Mo contents in Pt–MoO x /C catalysts, the activities of Pt–MoO x /C catalysts decreased. Combined with the composition and structure analyses, the differences in methanol oxidation on these catalysts were attributed to the interaction between the Pt particles and the MoO x /C support. It was suggested that the Pt metal–MoO x /C support interaction resulted in two effects. One was decreasing the Pt particle size; the other was decreasing the specific activities of these catalysts for methanol oxidation. Comprising these two contradictory effects, the mass activities of these catalysts for methanol oxidation increased.

CjHKDzXC.title: Biomass-derived N-doped carbon and its application in electrocatalysis
CjHKDzXC.abstract: The economical, green and sustainable preparation of functional carbon materials is of interest for energy storage and conversion technology. Herein, a functional N-doped carbon material (NC) was obtained from green biomass and cheap carbon black. The as-prepared NC enables the formation of highly-dispersed Pt nanocatalyst. Interestingly, compared to a state-of-the-art commercial Pt/C catalyst, the as-prepared Pt/NC catalyst shows a superior electrocatalytic performance with a 1.4-fold improvement in mass activity and a 1.5-fold enhancement in stability for methanol electrooxidation reaction. Thus, the green and earth-abundant biomass materials exhibit the promise in designing and producing functional carbon materials for high-performance electrochemical devices. ? 2014 Elsevier B.V.

OEwmXc3v.title: Ionic liquid-mediated synthesis of 'clean' palladium nanoparticles for formic acid electrooxidation
OEwmXc3v.abstract: Uniform Pd nanoparticles supported on Vulcan XC-72 carbon were successfully synthesised at room temperature using an ionic liquid (IL) as a mediator for the nucleation and growth process. The UV-vis spectra indicated that the IL interacted with the Pd precursor to form a complex that plays an important role in the nucleation and growth process of Pd nanoparticles. The IL-mediated synthesis of the Pd/C catalyst (Pd/C-IL) was extensively characterised by transmission electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, electrochemical CO ad stripping, linear scanning voltammetry and chronoamperometry. Physical characterisations revealed that the Pd/C-IL had an average size of 2.8 nm and a narrow size distribution. In addition, a very 'clean' surface was obtained for the Pd nanoparticles due to a weak interaction between the IL and the Pd nanoparticle surface resulting in the facile removal of the IL in the post-treatment process. More importantly, electrochemical studies demonstrated that, at an operating potential of 0.2 V, the catalytic activity of the Pd/C-IL was approximately 1.6 and 4.2-fold greater than the commercial Pd/C catalyst and the common Pd/C catalyst, respectively. © 2011, Hydrogen Energy Publications, LLC. Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

grPulapX.title: Surface reconstruction enhancing activity of Pt/C for formic acid electrooxidation by ultrasonic mixing with Pb/C and electrochemical activation process
grPulapX.abstract: The control for surface of catalysts is intrinsically required to improve catalytic efficiency. In current work, we demonstrate that the surface of Pt/C catalyst can be effectively reconstructed by ultrasonic mixing with Pb/C in an acidic environment and electorchemical activation process. As a result, the surface-reconstructed Pt/C catalyst exhibits a significant enhancement of activity of a ca. 10-fold improvement in mass activity and a ca. 38-fold improvement in specific activity as compared with a pure Pt/C catalyst for formic acid electroxidation (FAEO). The evidences show that some of Pb species are transferred from Pb/C to surface of Pt/C catalyst probably through the dissolution-adsorption pathway during ultrasonic mixing and electorchemical activation processes. The presence of Pb on surface of Pt not only isolates the continuous Pt sites through the third-body effect but also modifies electronic band structure of platinum via electronic effect, which leads to that the direct pathway is preferably occurred and the CO formation is effectively inhibited. These results provide useful information for further understanding the promotion mechanism of Pb ad-atom during FAEO and rationally controlling the catalytic surface to improve catalytic efficiency. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.

fDpnK3S3.title: Enhanced activity of Pt nano-crystals supported on a novel TiO 2@N-doped C nano-composite for methanol oxidation reaction
fDpnK3S3.abstract: The development of advanced support materials displays the potential for both reducing the cost and simultaneously increasing the activity of catalysts. In the current work, a novel N-doped carbon coated hydrophilic titanium dioxide (TiO 2@N-doped C) nano-composite, constructed by the procedure of an in situ polymerization and subsequent pyrolysis, was utilized to support Pt nano-crystals for the methanol oxidation reaction (MOR). The as-prepared Pt/TiO 2@N-doped C catalyst generated 1.74-fold higher activity, 2.08-fold higher stability and much better resistance to CO poisoning than a commercial state-of-the-art Pt/C catalyst. The enhanced catalytic performance was ascribed to the improved CO tolerance and the catalyst-support interaction due to the utilization of the TiO 2@N-doped C nano-composite, which not only provides rich active -OH groups to promote CO oxidation via the bifunctional mechanism, but also modifies the electronic structure of the Pt NPs to improve the intrinsic kinetics of MOR. The as-developed TiO 2@N-doped C nano-composite is a highly promising catalyst support material for use in fuel cell technology. © 2012 The Royal Society of Chemistry.

icRgXvQ5.title: Design and simulation of a liquid electrolyte passive direct methanol fuel cell with low methanol crossover
icRgXvQ5.abstract: Highlights ► LE-DMFC has a 30% lager maximum power density than C-DMFC with the same methanol concentration. ► The LE-DMFC can be fed with high concentration methanol. ► The LE-DMFC can obtain an energy density higher than 110 Wh L −1 . ► The LE-DMFC has a 100% higher fuel utilization than C-DMFC with the same methanol concentration. Abstract This study investigates an aqueous solution of sulfuric acid that serves as the liquid electrolyte (LE) in a passive direct methanol fuel cell (DMFC). The addition of an LE can reduce methanol crossover and increase the fuel utilization significantly. To improve the performance of an LE-DMFC, a mathematical model is developed to optimize the thicknesses of both the LE layer and the Nafion membrane. The maximum power density of the LE-DMFC is improved by approximately 30% compared with a conventional DMFC (C-DMFC) when each is fed by methanol solutions of the same concentration. Due to the low methanol crossover of the LE-DMFC, a highly concentrated methanol solution can be directly fed into the LE-DMFC. The discharge time and volume energy density of the LE-DMFC are two times longer and three times greater than those of the C-DMFC, respectively. In addition, fuel utilization increases by approximately 100%. Keywords Liquid electrolyte Passive direct methanol fuel cell Mathematical model Methanol crossover Highly concentrated methanol

CTeXkcBQ.title: Self-Healing Proton-Exchange Membranes Composed of Nafion-Poly(vinyl alcohol) Complexes for Durable Direct Methanol Fuel Cells.
CTeXkcBQ.abstract: Proton-exchange membranes (PEMs) that can heal mechanical damage to restore original functions are important for the fabrication of durable and reliable direct methanol fuel cells (DMFCs). The fabrication of healable PEMs that exhibit satisfactory mechanical stability, enhanced proton conductivity, and suppressed methanol permeability via hydrogen-bonding complexation between Nafion and poly(vinyl alcohol) (PVA) followed by postmodification with 4-carboxybenzaldehyde (CBA) molecules is presented. Compared with pure Nafion, the CBA/Nafion-PVA membranes exhibit enhanced mechanical properties with an ultimate tensile strength of ≈20.3 MPa and strain of ≈380%. The CBA/Nafion-PVA membrane shows a proton conductivity of 0.11 S cm at 80 °C, which is 1.2-fold higher than that of a Nafion membrane. The incorporated PVA gives the CBA/Nafion-PVA membranes excellent proton conductivity and methanol resistance. The resulting CBA/Nafion-PVA membranes are capable of healing mechanical damage of several tens of micrometers in size and restoring their original proton conductivity and methanol resistance under the working conditions of DMFCs. The healing property originates from the reversibility of hydrogen-bonding interactions between Nafion and CBA-modified PVA and the high chain mobility of Nafion and CBA-modified PVA.

BJeWVvWs.title: Low-temperature synthesis of nitrogen doped carbon nanotubes as promising catalyst support for methanol oxidation
BJeWVvWs.abstract: Abstract   The electrochemical methanol oxidation reaction (MOR) is of paramount importance for direct methanol fuel cell (DMFC) application, where efficient catalysts are required to facilitate the complicated multiple charge transfer process. The catalyst support not only determines the dispersion status of the catalysts particles, but also exerts great influence on the electronic structure of the catalysts, thereby altering its intrinsic activity. Herein, we demonstrated that nitrogen atoms, assisted by the pre-treatment of carbon matrix with oxidants, can be easily doped into carbon nanotubes at low temperature. The obtained nitrogen-doped carbon nanotubes can effectively improve the dispersion of the supported platinum nanoparticles and facilitate the MOR by modifying the electronic structure of platinum atoms, through catalyst-support interaction.

rAJSMt9A.title: Reductive-heat-treated platinum tungsten oxide catalyst with improved CO oxidation activity and its CO gas sensing property
rAJSMt9A.abstract: In this report, a reductive-heat-treated platinum tungsten oxide catalyst was prepared to improve the CO electro-oxidation activity and employed in the electrochemical sensor. Tungsten oxide was proved to be an effective co-catalyst for CO sensing and the strong interaction between platinum and tungsten oxide has been enhanced by the reductive heat treatment. As a result, the significant negative shift of CO oxidation potential was confirmed by an electrochemical characterization. Further, the sensing performance of the as-prepared catalyst was investigated by means of the portable CO sensor device, which showed higher sensitivity, faster response time and good linearity within 50 ppm CO.

4W2h2UjJ.title: On Improving the Performance of an Electronic-control Fuel Injector
4W2h2UjJ.abstract: We first studied the dynamic electromagnetic performance of an electronic-control fuel injector,then we analyzed the influence factors on it.By measuring the voltage change of a resistance which is series-wound in the driving circuit,the current response of electromagnetic loop was obtained.Ampere-turn and magnetic gap is the main influencing factors.According to the experimental data,we put forward measures for improving the structure of fuel injectors.Test data show that the electromagnetic property is indeed improved: opening time of valve changes from 1.4 ms to 1.1 ms and its closing time is reduced by 1.4 ms.

l93VsWOF.title: Arabidopsis CBP1 Is a Novel Regulator of Transcription Initiation in Central Cell-Mediated Pollen Tube Guidance.
l93VsWOF.abstract: In flowering plants, sperm cells are delivered to the embryo sac by a pollen tube guided by female signals. Both the gametic and synergid cells contribute to pollen tube attraction. Synergids secrete peptide signals that lure the tube, while the role of the gametic cells is unknown. Previously, we showed that CENTRAL CELL GUIDANCE (CCG) is essential for pollen tube attraction in Arabidopsis thaliana, but the molecular mechanism is unclear. Here, we identified CCG BINDING PROTEIN1 (CBP1) and demonstrated that it interacts with CCG, Mediator subunits, RNA polymerase II (Pol II), and central cell-specific AGAMOUS-like transcription factors. In addition, CCG interacts with TATA-box Binding Protein 1 and Pol II as a TFIIB-like transcription factor. CBP1-knockdown ovules are defective in pollen tube attraction. Expression profiling revealed that cysteine-rich peptide (CRP) transcripts were downregulated in ccg ovules. CCG and CBP1 coregulate a subset of CRPs in the central cell and the synergids, including the attractant LURE1. CBP1 is extensively expressed in multiple vegetative tissues and specifically in the central cell in reproductive growth. We propose that CBP1, via interaction with CCG and the Mediator complex, connects transcription factors and the Pol II machinery to regulate pollen tube attraction.

GNUhBgke.title: Fidelity Evaluation based Time Dilation in Hybrid Network Emulation
GNUhBgke.abstract: Hybrid network emulation has emerged as a new way to exploit advantages of both network simulation and emulation. Hybrid network emulation often uses a technology called time dilation to combat performance limitation. In order to implement accurate time dilation, we define the concept of Emulation Fidelity. We calculate the time dilation factor by evaluating Emulation Fidelity. Fidelity evaluation based time dilation improves correctness of large-scale high-throughput network emulation with maximum efficiency.

b38zHjyZ.title: Free-living human cells reconfigure their chromosomes in the evolution back to uni-cellularity.
b38zHjyZ.abstract: Cells of multi-cellular organisms evolve toward uni-cellularity in the form of cancer and, if humans intervene, continue to evolve in cell culture. During this process, gene dosage relationships may evolve in novel ways to cope with the new environment and may regress back to the ancestral uni-cellular state. In this context, the evolution of sex chromosomes vis-a-vis autosomes is of particular interest. Here, we report the chromosomal evolution in ~ 600 cancer cell lines. Many of them jettisoned either Y or the inactive X; thus, free-living male and female cells converge by becoming 'de-sexualized'. Surprisingly, the active X often doubled, accompanied by the addition of one haploid complement of autosomes, leading to an X:A ratio of 2:3 from the extant ratio of 1:2. Theoretical modeling of the frequency distribution of X:A karyotypes suggests that the 2:3 ratio confers a higher fitness and may reflect aspects of sex chromosome evolution.

wmE1VoRn.title: A metal-organic framework devised Co-N doped carbon microsphere/nanofiber hybrid as a free-standing 3D oxygen catalyst.
wmE1VoRn.abstract: A Co-N doped 3D carbon microsphere/nanofiber hybrid was produced by electrospinning. We can effectively control the morphology transformation from a pearl necklace-like nanofiber to a microsphere/nanofiber hybrid. The hybrid shows Pt-like oxygen reduction reaction activity both in acidic and basic solutions, making it one of the best non-noble metal oxygen catalysts.

rTal8ldb.title: Early Different Downstream Target of Glucocorticoid Receptor Contributing to Glucocorticoids Sensitivity in Kasumi-1 Cells
rTal8ldb.abstract: The t(8;21) chromosome translocation frequently occurs in acute myeloid leukemia (AML), resulting in an in-frame fusion between the DNA-binding domain of  AML1  and almost the entire of  ETO  gene. The fusion AML1-ETO protein is thought to play a critical role in the abnormal proliferation and differentiation of myeloid leukemia cells, such as Kasumi-1 and SKNO-1 cells. Glucocorticoids (GC) can induce apoptosis in these cells at low concentrations, whereas most other myeloid leukemia cell lines are resistant to glucocorticoid-induced apoptosis. To experimentally address possible sensitive mechanisms in leukemia cells with AML1-ETO translocation, we generated aGC-resistant Kasumi-1 cell line by induction of 10 -6  M dexamethasone (Dex) for three weeks. The IC 50  of Dex to cells is increased from 2.5×10 -8  M for original GC-sensitive Kasumi-1 cell line ( K-S cell line) to more than 1×10 -5  M for induced GC-resistant Kasumi-1 cell line (K-R cell line). Since GC resistance often results from mutations in the glucocorticoid receptor (GR), all the exons of  GR  gene were sequenced and no mutation was found in K-R cells. Comparing to those in K-S cells, the GR protein level didn9t decrease in K-R cells after 2h, 4h, 8h, 12h and 24h exposure to dexamethasone. Given that the difference of direct GR downstream genes between K-S and K-R cells may play a key role in the GC sensitivity, we systematically analyzed the changes of gene expression induced by Dex versus ethanol vehicle for 8h in K-S and K-R cells by high throughput RNA sequencing. The time point of 8h was selected according to the expression peaks of several foregone GR target genes after Dex induction. There were found 32 genes conversely regulated in K-S and K-R cells, including 14 mRNAs and 18 long non-coding RNAs. Pathway analysis indicated that the upregulated genes in K-S cells might promote the AML1-ETO fusion protein degradation by proteasomes, while the component genes of this pathway were downregulated in K-R cells. Further validation and function studies of these mRNAs and long non-coding RNAs are ongoing. Our data suggested that the downstream targets of GR among GC-sensitive and -resistant Kasumi-1 cells were significant different and they may contribute to the GC sensitivity and resistance by degradation or reservation of AML-ETO fusion protein and the regulation of apoptosis in t(8;21) leukemia cell subtype.  Disclosures  No relevant conflicts of interest to declare.

rIHDd7Ec.title: Crosslinking effect in nanocrystalline cellulose reinforced sulfonated poly(aryl ether ketone) proton exchange membranes
rIHDd7Ec.abstract: Abstract   Two novel series of poly(aryl ether ketone)s (PAEK) bearing pendant carboxylic acid groups have been synthesized, and subsequently sulfonated to obtain sulfonated poly(aryl ether ketone)s with carboxylic acid groups (SPAEK-COOH- x ). The expected structures of the sulfonated copolymers were confirmed by FTIR. Modified nanocrystalline cellulose (NCC) was prepared and introduced into the SPAEK-COOH- x  as the “performance-enhancing” filler and crosslinking agent. The nanocomposite proton exchange membranes were prepared via a solution-casting procedure. The composite membranes containing NCC presented the higher proton conductivity and better mechanical properties. After further crosslinking, the covalent crosslinked composite membranes showed even better mechanical properties while the proton conductivity and thermal stability were maintained. The hydrophilic/hydrophobic domains were observed from the TEM morphology investigation of COOH-10/NCC- y  and C/COOH-10/NCC- y  membranes. A balance of mechanical stabilities, proton conductivity, and thermal property could be designed by the incorporation of NCC and the crosslinking between NCC and SPAEK-COOH-10 to meet the requirements for the applications in the fuel cells.

mCaujbZ5.title: Investigation on the status of human resources for AIDS control at city and county level in Hebei
mCaujbZ5.abstract: Objective To understand the status of human resources for AIDS control at city and county level in Hebei Province,and to improve the outfit of human resources.Methods General investigation and self-designed questionnaire were used by the trained investigators.Epi Data 3.0 was used to establish a database,and SPSS 13.0 was used to analyze the data.Results There were 1 347 missionaries at the city and county level,547 of whom were full-time staff.Significant differences existed in academic qualifications and titles between city and county level.A lack in technical staff in county level appeared.Conclusions The number of staff for HIV control in Hebei is not sufficient.Therefore human resources in these places should be strengthened and rationally allocated for AIDS control.

pOKiGmuF.title: Comparative study on the effect of highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) in patients with HIV infection acquired by blood transfusion and paid plasma donation]
pOKiGmuF.abstract: To study the effect of HAART in patients with AIDS acquire by blood transfusion and paid plasma donation.All AIDS patients whose disease was caused by blood transfusion and commercial plasma donation came from the domicile of Hebei Province. In the group of cases of blood transfusion in whom the infection was caused by one-time blood transfusion before and after 1995, there were 189 cases, of whom 105 cases on HAART were designated as observation group, and 84 cases who were not on HAART were designated as control group. The group of AIDS patients who were former commercial plasma donors (FCPDs) had 120 patients who were identified in the survey of 1995, of whom 63 cases on HAART were designated as observation group and 57 cases who were not on HAART were as control group. Onset dates were defined as the dates into the queue. Death due to AIDS was regarded as an outcome event. Subjects who were enrolled into the observation group and control group were epidemiologically followed up regularly. Observation was ended on December 31, 2010.Mortality of patients after HAART from groups of FCPDs and blood recipients were 4.42/100 person-years and 6.13/100 person-years, respectively. The survival rates of HAART groups were 80% in FCPDs for 110 months and 72% in blood recipients for 90 months, respectively. Meanwhile the mortality of no HAART groups were 182.05/100 person-years and 250.66/100 person-years, respectively. Mean survival of patients whose disease was caused by plasma donation and blood transfusion were 4 months and 3 months, respectively.Whether the HIV infection was caused by plasmapheresis or blood transfusion, the effects of HAART did not show difference. HAART cold reduce the death intensity and prolong survival.

TNBgJFpM.title: Retrospective cohort study on the rate of mother-to-child transmission among mothers infected with human immunodeficiency virus type 1 through blood transfusion]
TNBgJFpM.abstract: To study the rate of mother-to-child transmission (MTCT) on HIV-1.All local residents from 8 townships in a region were screened for mothers who had a history of only one blood transfusion and 63 were found HIV-1 positive. A further study on these HIV-1 positive mothers and their children was conducted with the emphasis on the date of receiving blood transfusion, date and type of nationality, history regarding breastfeeding and so on. Sera specimens from 84 children born from 63 HIV-1 positive mothers were screened, using ELISA for HIV-1 antibody, and positive specimens were confirmed by Western-blot.The rate of MTCT was 32.1% (27/84) for children with all risk factors related to MTCT. Another 36.8% (7/19) were related to factors on intrauterine, intrapartum and breastfeeding, 35.7% (5/14) to intrapartum and breastfeeding factors, 14.3% (2/14) to intrauterine and intrapartum factors, 37.9% (11/29) to breastfeeding factor alone. By group combination analysis, the MTCT rate was 36.9% (24/65) with breastfeeding, 11.8% (2/17) with artificial feeding, and the former was significantly higher than the latter.HIV-1 MTCT rate among mothers caused by a single blood transfusion varied with different risk factors. Breastfeeding played an important role in MTCT, appeared in our study.

authors.name: Su-Liang Chen

9VFXL9A0.title: The expression of apoptosis-related factors-caspase-3 and caspase-9 in human clear cell renal cell carcinoma
9VFXL9A0.abstract: Objective To detect the proliferation,apoptosis and expression of apoptosis-related factors-Caspase-3 and Caspase-9 in human clear cell renal cell carcinoma(RCCC)tissues in order to explore the correlation between the two factors and RCCC.Methods The samples were divided into three groups:RCCC group,para-cancerous tissues group and normal tissue group.All the samples were fixed in formalin for 48 h,embedded in paraffin wax,sectioned to 5 μm thick slice,then observed by immunohistochemical method.Results The expression of caspase-3 and caspase-9 was weakly positive in normal renal tissue.The expression was increased in para-cancerous tissue.The expression was significantly decreased in RCCC tissue.There were significant differences among three groups(P<0.01),but there were no significant differences among 4 stages(P>0.05).Conclusion The expression of caspase-3 and caspase-9 protein in para-cancerous tissue is significantly higher than that in normal renal tissue,which is the lowest in RCCC tissue.The results suggest that the decrease of cell apoptosis and increase of cell proliferation is one of the important mechanisms in the tumor formation.There is no significant difference in the expression of caspase-3 and caspase-9 in different stages of renal clear cell carcinoma.

Z7TPlDMi.title: Retrospective cohort study on period of incubation and survival among former commercial plasma donors infected with HIV in Hebei province]
Z7TPlDMi.abstract: To examine the state of incubation period and survival time of former commercial plasma donors (FCPDs) infected with HIV.All objects infected with HIV were from Hebei province and found from general investigation for FCPDs in 1995. The infector cohort by 142 cases was used to estimate incubation period. In the infector cohort, the time which infectors entered the cohort was their infection time, which was the middle value of the origin date, which was January 1, 1995. The onset of AIDS was defined as an outcome event. End point of observation was Dec 31, 2010. There were 192 months in all from beginning to end. The AIDS cohort by 57 cases was used to estimate the survival of the patients. In the patient cohort, the time of AIDS onset was defined as the time entering the cohort, and death of AIDS was defined as an outcome event. The cumulative incidence ratio, cumulative mortality, illness intensity and mortality intensity were analyzed through Kaplan-Meier.During the observation period, 123 cases of 142 infectors developed into AIDS, the cumulative incidence was 86.42% (123/142) and the intensity was 8.53/100 person-years and the median time of incubation period was 112.0 months (95%CI: 108.8 - 115.2). The death dates of 57 patients were from 1 to 24 months after onset. The cumulative mortality was 100%, and the intensity was 250.66/100 person-years and the median survival time was 3.0 months (95%CI: 1.8 - 4.2). It was estimated that the median time was 115.0 months (9.6 years) from infection to death.The median times of incubation and median survival time were 112.0 and 3.0 months, respectively.

eboKYqSv.title: Status of sentinel montoring of HIV/AIDS in Hebei Province
eboKYqSv.abstract: Aim To understand the status of sentinel monitoring of HIV/AIDS in Hebei Province.Methods The data of sentinel monitoring of HIV/AIDS at national level and provincial level were collected and analyzed.Results Up to the year 2006,there were 6 national level moitoring sites and 11 provincial level sites covering 11 cities in this province.The monitoring included the outpatients at the sexual disease clinics,commercial sex workers,drug addicts,blood donors,pregnant women,long-distance truck drivers and so on.Conclusion HIV/AIDS sentinel monitoring system covering the whole province had been established and scientific evidence have been provided for drawing up interventions and evaluation activities.But more sentinel sites be set up to meet the control and prevention need in this province.

npVdoSov.title: The expression of proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) in the human clear cell renal cell carcinoma
npVdoSov.abstract: Objective To detect the expression of proliferating cell nuclear antigen(PCNA)in the human clear cell renal cell carcinoma(RCCC)tissues in order to explore the correlations between the antigen expression and RCCC.Methods The samples were divided into three groups:RCCC group,para-cancerous tissue group and normal tissue group.All the samples were fixed in formalin for 48h,embedded in paraffin wax,sectioned to 5μm thick slice,and observed by immunohistochemical method.Results PCNA immunohistochemical staining showed that the expression of PCNA was weakly positive in the nucleus of the normal renal tissue.The expression was slightly higher in para-cancerous tissue than that in normal renal tissue.The expression was significantly increased in RCCC tissue,which was significantly higher than that in para-cancerous tissue(P<0.01),but there were no significant differences among 4 stages(P>0.05).Conclusion the expression of PCNA in RCCC tissue is higher than that in para-cancerous tissue,which is the lowest in normal renal tissue.It may be one of the important mechanisms in tumor formation.

hcFeJdYn.title: Analysis for the correlation between CD_4~+ cell counts and opportunistic infections in patients with HIV/AIDS
hcFeJdYn.abstract: Objective To investigate the correlation between CD4+ cell counts and opportunistic infections in patients with HIV/AIDS within 6-month therapy.Methods The correlation between CD4+ cell counts and opportunistic infections within 6-month therapy were analyzed in 136 patients with HIV/AIDS.Results After 3-month therapy there were 87.5%(119/136)of the patients whose CD4+T cell counts ≤200/μl,however,after 6-month therapy there were 41.9%(57/136)of the patients whose CD4+T cell counts≤200/μl. Among 136 patients whose CD4+T cell counts≤200/μl at early therapy,there were 82 cases of opportunistic infections,with the infection rate was 60.3%,while,after 6-month therapy there were only 3 cases of opportunistic infections in 79 patients whose CD4+T cell counts >200/μl,with infection rate was 3.8%.Conclusion The AIDS patients with CD4+ cell counts over 200/μl have litter probability to occur opportunistic infection,but the probability will increase obviously when their CD4+ cell counts are below 200/μl. The opportunistic infections are liable to occur for the AIDS patients with CD4+T cell counts <200/μl at initial therapy.

6VABFUfa.title: Following surveillance on HIV infection after blood transfusion]
6VABFUfa.abstract: To study epidemiological features of HIV infection after blood transfusion and the situation of transmission among members of family.The persons infected with HIV through blood transfusion and their intrafamilial transmission in some city were analyzed and testing methods of ELISA, Western-blot, RT-PCR and subtype analyzing were used. The whole surveillance data came from residents investigation around problem medical centres and HIV monitoring network around Hebei province.173 people infected with HIV after blood transfusion in some city, including 89 cases found in hospital and 84 cases in CDC, accounted for 68.7% (173/252) of all of infected persons by blood transfusion in Hebei province. The rate of intrafamilial transmission, spousal transmission and mother-to-child transmission((MTCT) were 32.0% (49/153),17.0% (26/153) and 32.7% (32/98), respectively. Most of persons infected with HIV were youth among who the female were more than the male. Childbearing and women's ailments were the main cause of blood transfusion from 1990 to 1999, and traumatism surgery took second place. Infected persons by HIV blood, whose time to diagnostic were the year from 1999 to 2009, spread over Kangtai hospital and other hospital which accounted for 45.1% (78/173) and 42.2% (73/173), respectively. The genetype of all patients were B' subtype.The medical centers at the grass-roots level in some city resulted in outbreak of infected persons by HIV blood because of having no screening test antibody of HIV for liid blood donors.

n6NsXBoI.title: A SURVEY OF HIV INFECTION AMONG DRUG ADDICTSIN SOME CITY OF HEBEI PROVINCE
n6NsXBoI.abstract: Objective: To understand the state of HIV infection among drug addicts and take further measures to solve problems in time.Methods:An investigation was conducted among public security,judiciary and city level health center prevention AIDS office through listening report,searching data and rap session.Results:There were 39.29%(44/112)HIV infected people by injection drug in the city,and 90.91%(40/44)of them located in the town.Thirty one HIV infectied people,arrested by police in 6.23 action,were past-infected person who were confirmed by CDC.Conclusion:The drug addicts had high risk behaviors for HIV transmission.We should increase the level of administration of HIV infected people and take effective measures to prevent HIV from transmission.
